**Rail Wheel Factory**  
**रेल व्हील फैक्टरी** [Type](/wiki/List_of_business_entities "List of business entities") | [Government-owned corporation](/wiki/Government-owned_corporation "Government-owned corporation")  
---|---  
Industry | Wheels, Coaches and Locomotives  
Founded | 1984  
Headquarters | [Yelahanka](/wiki/Yelahanka "Yelahanka"), [Bangalore](/wiki/Bangalore "Bangalore"), [India](/wiki/India "India")  
Area served | India  
Products | Wheels for All railway wagons of Indian Railways  
Owner | [Government of India](/wiki/Government_of_India "Government of India") (100%)  
  
**Rail Wheel Factory** (RWF) ([Hindi](/wiki/Hindi_language "Hindi language"):
**रेल व्हील फैक्टरी**) (also known as Wheel and Axle Plant) is a manufacturing
unit of [Indian Railways](/wiki/Indian_Railways "Indian Railways"), producing
wheels, axles and wheel sets of railroad wagons, coaches and locomotives for
the use of Indian Railways and overseas customers is situated at
[Yelahanka](/wiki/Yelahanka "Yelahanka"), [Bangalore](/wiki/Bangalore
"Bangalore") in the Indian state of [Karnataka](/wiki/Karnataka "Karnataka").

The unit was started by [C. K. Jaffer Sharief](/wiki/C._K._Jaffer_Sharief "C.
K. Jaffer Sharief"), the then [Railway
Minister](/wiki/Minister_of_Railways_\(India\) "Minister of Railways
\(India\)"), who got this project to Bangalore. It was commissioned in 1984 to
manufacture wheels and axles for the Indian Railways.

This factory uses cast steel technology in the manufacturing of wheels which
utilizes scrap steel collected from Railways' own workshops as raw material.
The products (Wheels, [Axles](/wiki/Axles "Axles") and wheel sets) are
engineered with little scrap for human errors. It has a planned capacity to
manufacture of about 70,000 wheels of different sizes, 23,000 axles and to
assemble 23,000 wheel sets. It employs over 2000 personnel and has an annual
turnover of about 82 crores. It is an [ISO 9001:2000](/wiki/ISO_9001:2000 "ISO
9001:2000") and [ISO 14001](/wiki/ISO_14001 "ISO 14001") certified unit for
its business processes. It was the first unit of [Indian
Railways](/wiki/Indian_Railways "Indian Railways") to receive [ISO
9001:2008](/wiki/ISO_9001:2008 "ISO 9001:2008") accreditation.[1]
